titles.title: A bill to ensure that Federal lands are managed in a manner that does not impair the exercise of traditional American Indian religion.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Hearings held.

bill.summary: 3/31/1988--Introduced. Prohibits Federal lands that historically have been indispensable to a traditional American Indian religion from being managed in a manner that would seriously impair the exercise of such religion, except in cases involving compelling governmental interests.
